intro: Microchaeta cavarum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microchaeta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. The plant's unique floral structure and adaptability to humid conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
